<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/09/need-know-uns-new-climate-report?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The UN Sounds All the Alarms
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/09/need-know-uns-new-climate-report?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of the planet Earth sitting on top of crumpled cigarettes in a grey ashtray. Smoke fumes are rising off the top of the Earth." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzcwL2NvMi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), an official UN task force, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/climate-change-global-warming-un-report-ipcc-1d89d5183583718ad4ad311fa2ee7d83?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> a 3,949-page report from 234 scientists yesterday that called current climate change trends a “code red for humanity.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Here’s what you need to know</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s all our fault. </strong>If there was any doubt that maybe we could partly blame volcanoes for climate change, the IPCC put it to rest. “It is unequivocal that human influence has warmed the atmosphere, ocean, and land,” the scientists wrote. They found that human activity has increased the global average temperature by about 2 degrees Fahrenheit since the Industrial Revolution of the 19th century.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Weather goes mid-2000s candy “EXXTREME!”</strong> Tropical storms, heat waves, wildfires, droughts, and flooding are all expected to get more severe and more frequent if climate change continues at its current rate, the report said.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>More extreme weather shouldn't just be thought of in the future tense, but the here and now. Just last week Greece, Turkey, and much of the Western US </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/dixie-fire-becomes-thirdlargest-fire-california-history?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">experienced</a></span><span> some of their worst wildfires in history. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">All eyes on the energy industry.</strong> The report blamed one particular human activity for exacerbating climate change: burning fossil fuels. CO2 levels in the atmosphere are the highest they’ve been in 2 million years. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“This report must sound a death knell for coal and fossil fuels before they destroy our planet," UN Secretary-general Antonio Guterres said. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There’s a little hope.</strong> Since the IPCC’s last big report in 2013, countries have done a better job in curbing carbon emissions. But they need to speed up those cuts dramatically, the report argued. Otherwise, it will be nearly impossible to keep global temps from spiraling higher.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>world leaders will head to Glasgow, Scotland, in November for the pivotal COP26 international climate talks. They'll be tasked with taking the IPCC's scientific report and turning it into meaningful policy. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/09/democrats-announce-35-trillion-budget-plan?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Dems' Budget Outline Is Yuge
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/09/democrats-announce-35-trillion-budget-plan?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of the White House in front of a teal background. A large, rolled up receipt that unfurls to the edge of the picture sits at the base of the building's entrance.  " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MjY1L3doaXRlX2hvdXNlX2J1ZGdldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the bipartisan $1 trillion infrastructure bill set to pass the Senate this morning, Democrats want to keep the momentum going with another massive government project—a <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/08/09/1026055615/senate-democrats-release-3-5t-budget-framework?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$3.5 trillion</a> budget framework they released yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Spending will go toward...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Universal pre-K and child care of working families</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Two free years of community college </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Expanded Medicare to cover hearing, dental, and vision care </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Public housing </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Clean energy development </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters:</strong> The plan represents the biggest investment in the social safety net in decades, per the NYT. “At its core, this legislation is about restoring the middle class in the 21st century,” Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer wrote in a statement. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"Thanks, I hate it," said Republicans, who consider the framework way too expensive and also oppose the tax increases Democrats have put forward to fund it. Unfortunately for them, Democrats could push it through later this year without any GOP support thanks to their thin majority in the Senate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One high-stakes battle remains: </strong>the debt ceiling, aka the limit on the US' ability to borrow money. Democrats will need to find a way to raise or suspend it soon to avoid economic chaos. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/09/car-rental-industry-rebounds-economy-rockets-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Rental Car Companies Are Looking Like New
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From pandemic-demolished to meme stock legend to actual business turnaround—that's the Hertz story. One year after it filed for bankruptcy, the car rental company posted a 62% jump in sales and plans to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/hertz-posts-higher-revenue-plans-to-relist-amid-travel-rebound-11628518964?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">relist on a major stock exchange</a> by the end of 2021.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The great Covid comeback story</strong>: Hertz went bankrupt last June at the peak of the pandemic, weighed down by nearly $19 billion in debt and roughly 700,000 cars parked with no one to drive them. This May, it reached a deal with private equity firms to pull itself out of bankruptcy, rewarding the individual investors who made the company the OG meme stock. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The surge in summer travel and the nationwide shortage of used cars has fueled the rebound of the rental car industry. Searches for rentals nearly doubled in late June over the same period in 2019, according to Kayak.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And to cap off a successful Monday for the sector, Turo, the “Airbnb for cars,” <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/08/09/car-sharing-startup-turo-has-filed-confidentially-for-an-ipo/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed for an IPO</a> confidentially yesterday. After cutting about a third of its workforce during Covid, Turo reported its first-ever profitable quarter this year.</p>

And, because YOLO, the company will accept bitcoin at all its US locations by the end of the year.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/09/nasa-looking-human-guinea-pigs-simulated-mars-mission?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
NASA Is Recruiting Human Guinea Pigs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/09/nasa-looking-human-guinea-pigs-simulated-mars-mission?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Mars Dune Alpha habitat" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTY0L21hcnNfZHVuZV9hbHBoYV9oYWJpdGF0LnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>NASA</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you want to get away from it all—Covid, climate change, people who just text “hey”—NASA is giving you an opportunity to live on fake Mars for a year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The agency has <a href="https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-oddities-business-science-mars-182cc63732fbabeb7120df2fc637b85a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opened up applications</a> for four people to live in a 3D-printed Martian habitat it built inside its Houston HQ. NASA will use this experiment to help prepare for actual missions to the Red Planet.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Job responsibilities:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Go on simulated spacewalks.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Eat space food, grow crops like Matt Damon, and play around with virtual reality equipment.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Coexist with three strangers in a 1,700-square-foot room for a year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Job qualifications:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>American citizen or permanent US resident aged 30–55.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A master’s degree in a science, engineering, or math-related field. </span><span><em>Or </em></span><span>be a fighter pilot.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Must not derive pleasure from looking out of windows, because there aren’t any.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>If you’re basically an astronaut already and don’t want to pay rent for a year, this could be the gig for you. If not, we hear Richard Branson is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/science/bransons-virgin-galactic-sell-space-flight-tickets-starting-450000-2021-08-05/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">selling tickets</a> to space for $450,000 a pop.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F08%2F09%2Fnasa-looking-human-guinea-pigs-simulated-mars-mission" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">

</font></a>
</h1>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/09/new-office-politics-existential-crisis?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="keyboard" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTE5L2JhY2tfdG9fd29yay5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks to Covid-19, work will never be the same. But <em>how </em>it will not be the same is less clear.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As companies prepare to bring workers back to the office (eventually), we’re going to spend the week releasing stories that’ll make you smarter about the thorny politics, awkward vaccination conversations, and workplace attire debates that are bound to arise as employees leave their couches behind.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Up first: Why managing a hybrid workplace is going to be a <em>lot</em> more complicated than you think. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/09/new-office-politics-existential-crisis?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read it here</a>.</p>
</td>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>It’s like a crossword, but smaller. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/09/brew-mini-code?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play the Mini here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Famous book lines</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday was Book Lovers Day. We’re book lovers, and we assume you are too, so this quiz will test your knowledge of famous lines from literature. We’ll give you a line from a book, and you’ll have to name the book. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Who controls the past controls the future. Who controls the present controls the past.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The answer to the great question...of Life, the Universe and Everything...is...forty-two.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Aunt Lydia said it was best not to speak unless they asked you a direct question. Try to think of it from their point of view she said, her hands clasped and wrung together, her nervous pleading smile."</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Ralph wept for the end of innocence, the darkness of man’s heart, and the fall through the air of the true, wise friend called Piggy.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“A man ain’t a goddamn ax. Chopping, hacking, busting every goddamn minute of the day. Things get to him. Things he can’t chop down because they’re inside.”</span></li>
</ol>
</td>

Smoke fumes are rising off the top of the Earth.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzcwL2NvMi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), an official UN task force, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/climate-change-global-warming-un-report-ipcc-1d89d5183583718ad4ad311fa2ee7d83?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e a 3,949-page report from 234 scientists yesterday that called current climate change trends a “code red for humanity.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHere’s what you need to know\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s all our fault. \u003c/strong\u003eIf there was any doubt that maybe we could partly blame volcanoes for climate change, the IPCC put it to rest. “It is unequivocal that human influence has warmed the atmosphere, ocean, and land,” the scientists wrote. They found that human activity has increased the global average temperature by about 2 degrees Fahrenheit since the Industrial Revolution of the 19th century.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWeather goes mid-2000s candy “EXXTREME!”\u003c/strong\u003e Tropical storms, heat waves, wildfires, droughts, and flooding are all expected to get more severe and more frequent if climate change continues at its current rate, the report said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMore extreme weather shouldn't just be thought of in the future tense, but the here and now. Just last week Greece, Turkey, and much of the Western US \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/06/dixie-fire-becomes-thirdlargest-fire-california-history?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexperienced\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e some of their worst wildfires in history. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAll eyes on the energy industry.\u003c/strong\u003e The report blamed one particular human activity for exacerbating climate change: burning fossil fuels. CO2 levels in the atmosphere are the highest they’ve been in 2 million years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“This report must sound a death knell for coal and fossil fuels before they destroy our planet,\" UN Secretary-general Antonio Guterres said. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere’s a little hope.\u003c/strong\u003e Since the IPCC’s last big report in 2013, countries have done a better job in curbing carbon emissions. But they need to speed up those cuts dramatically, the report argued. Otherwise, it will be nearly impossible to keep global temps from spiraling higher.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eworld leaders will head to Glasgow, Scotland, in November for the pivotal COP26 international climate talks. They'll be tasked with taking the IPCC's scientific report and turning it into meaningful policy. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith the bipartisan $1 trillion infrastructure bill set to pass the Senate this morning, Democrats want to keep the momentum going with another massive government project—a \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/08/09/1026055615/senate-democrats-release-3-5t-budget-framework?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$3.5 trillion\u003c/a\u003e budget framework they released yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpending will go toward...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUniversal pre-K and child care of working families\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwo free years of community college \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eExpanded Medicare to cover hearing, dental, and vision care \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePublic housing \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eClean energy development \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters:\u003c/strong\u003e The plan represents the biggest investment in the social safety net in decades, per the NYT. “At its core, this legislation is about restoring the middle class in the 21st century,” Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer wrote in a statement. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"Thanks, I hate it,\" said Republicans, who consider the framework way too expensive and also oppose the tax increases Democrats have put forward to fund it. Unfortunately for them, Democrats could push it through later this year without any GOP support thanks to their thin majority in the Senate.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne high-stakes battle remains: \u003c/strong\u003ethe debt ceiling, aka the limit on the US' ability to borrow money. New\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrom pandemic-demolished to meme stock legend to actual business turnaround—that's the Hertz story. One year after it filed for bankruptcy, the car rental company posted a 62% jump in sales and plans to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/hertz-posts-higher-revenue-plans-to-relist-amid-travel-rebound-11628518964?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erelist on a major stock exchange\u003c/a\u003e by the end of 2021.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe great Covid comeback story\u003c/strong\u003e: Hertz went bankrupt last June at the peak of the pandemic, weighed down by nearly $19 billion in debt and roughly 700,000 cars parked with no one to drive them. This May, it reached a deal with private equity firms to pull itself out of bankruptcy, rewarding the individual investors who made the company the OG meme stock. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The surge in summer travel and the nationwide shortage of used cars has fueled the rebound of the rental car industry. Searches for rentals nearly doubled in late June over the same period in 2019, according to Kayak.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd to cap off a successful Monday for the sector, Turo, the “Airbnb for cars,” \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/08/09/car-sharing-startup-turo-has-filed-confidentially-for-an-ipo/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled for an IPO\u003c/a\u003e confidentially yesterday. After cutting about a third of its workforce during Covid, Turo reported its first-ever profitable quarter this year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you want to get away from it all—Covid, climate change, people who just text “hey”—NASA is giving you an opportunity to live on fake Mars for a year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe agency has \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-oddities-business-science-mars-182cc63732fbabeb7120df2fc637b85a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopened up applications\u003c/a\u003e for four people to live in a 3D-printed Martian habitat it built inside its Houston HQ. NASA will use this experiment to help prepare for actual missions to the Red Planet.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJob responsibilities:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGo on simulated spacewalks.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEat space food, grow crops like Matt Damon, and play around with virtual reality equipment.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCoexist with three strangers in a 1,700-square-foot room for a year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJob qualifications:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAmerican citizen or permanent US resident aged 30–55.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA master’s degree in a science, engineering, or math-related field. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eOr \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ebe a fighter pilot.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMust not derive pleasure from looking out of windows, because there aren’t any.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you’re basically an astronaut already and don’t want to pay rent for a year, this could be the gig for you. target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eselling tickets\u003c/a\u003e to space for $450,000 a
